metadata.Title: CVE-2022-42856 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A type confusion issue was addressed with improved state handling. This issue is fixed in Safari 16.2, tvOS 16.2, macOS Ventura 13.1, iOS 15.7.2 and iPadOS 15.7.2, iOS 16.1.2. Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to arbitrary code execution. Apple is aware of a report that this issue may have been actively exploited against versions of iOS released before iOS 15.1..

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-42856` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.38.3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.38.3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.38.3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.38.3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.38.3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37-gtk2 - 2.38.3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
webkit2gtk-driver - 2.38.3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> webkit receives limited support. For details, see https://wiki.ubuntu.com/SecurityTeam/FAQ#webkit webkit in Ubuntu uses the JavaScriptCore (JSC) engine, not V8

criterions.comment: qtwebkit-opensource-src package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
webkit2gtk package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.38.3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
wpewebkit package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
